comments.body: I agree. As someone who came from legacy console edition, this is SOOOOOO annoying! I swear I'm even getting attacked unprovoked at times. Enderman never bothered me on legacy but they are WAY too sensitive on Bedrock. They just need to be tuned a little bit.
I think it may possibly be due to the limitations of C++, but this would still be great.
It was added in beta 1.15.0.51, but they didn't mention it in the changelog.
That should be marked as released.
Estar√≠a chido üòé
Muy bien para hacer videos

Yeah,playing on a splitscreen world on ps4 with my friends or family is fun..but sometimes they would troll me or tease me by not sleeping.This is why it should also be in the bedrock version because splitscreen kinda also work like a server.
It should be a game setting so if you want this enabled it can be.

Gamerule PlayerSleepPercentage being granted only to Java has caused a lot of confusion. Since most addons for Bedrock disable achievements, it's a real pain on Realms when there is a group working in the Nether.

Yes.  This is a big deal on realms with more than a few people.   Multiple people on the realm at the same time means that everyone has to not only agree to sleep - but also have a bed and be in a place where they can easily do it.  I would much rather set my realms so that only one player needs to sleep.  Then the only thing that needs to happen if someone actually *needs* it to be night time is for them to ask that no one else sleep.  It still requires agreement but it doesn't require people to be in a convenient location with the right equipment.

Right now, the only option on realms to make it morning is for anyone who is unable to sleep to temporarily log off and then log back on.  What a pain.  PlayerSleepPercentage would make this a whole lot easier.
That should be marked as released.
Has now been added.

In Bedrock Edition, (Win10 and Bedrock) our Mob Farms are extremely slow, bedrock already has alot of disadvatages over java, adding trident killers to java will mean alot of players would move to java because of the better features, that means the imbalance it brings will most likely lead to bedrock edition shutting down, so i disagree

If I'm not mistaken, trident killers are considered a bug in Bedrock Edition. 

Here's a link to the bug report. 

https://bugs.mojang.com/browse/MCPE-46369
@FlaredCoder1820 Actually, it's not a bug. If you see the last comment on that link you posted they state that it's working as intended.
I'm making a trident killer design for Java actually. 100% onto something. Its not that it doesnt work, its that the concept is so much different
Any luck?

I know this post is old but I'd share my input in case somebody new comes by, trident killers shouldn't exist in Java for a few reasons:
    Java has access to auto-clickers. Because Java is on pc only, auto-clickers are accessible to all players and 99% of the player base is perfectly fine with using autoclickers. 
    Trident killers were originally a bug. At the end of the day, they were a bug much like the TNT duper system that Mojang said they thought was not only a cool new thing but balanced enough to keep in the game. This however means it's likely difficult to recode from Bedrock to Java since it was never intentionally added and is just something they keep in the game. 
    Java was already given an alternative. The ONLY good thing to come from the combat update was sweeping edge. This as everyone knows allows the player to kill all the mobs in the kill chamber. Combine this with an auto-clicker and you have the same efficiency as a trident killer.

As a Bedrock player who has only played Bedrock but now connects to Java servers via Geyser through my Ps5/Bedrock Together we don't have access to auto clickers. Everybody who was with me on my Bedrock server came with me to start a Java Multiverse and are coming to find out that we hate Java, lol. A working trident killer would help with some of that frustration. Just my 2 cents
A 3D fishing bobber would be great! There should be a graphic toggle for the 2D bobber.
I think the death messages should also be able to be visible on the death screen as well.
Death messages in Bedrock are horrible and don't make much sense. If you are killed by an arrow it says Name was shot by Arrow and doesn't tell you what the arrow was from. COME ON MOJANG, REALLY?
It's so unfair
If you want to be "pricked to death" or "playername __ whilst fighting playername/entity", sorry, you just get the basic message "playername died" and message "playername __"

Optifine should not be needed to edit the water colour for each biome in Minecraft Java, so resource packs that bring water colour parity are possible in the unmodded game.

And maybe fallen mushroom-tree in Crimson Forest nad Warped Forest?

This is basically the only bedrock feature I feel like I'm missing out on. It's such a small thing, but it really makes forests feel so much more interesting. There must be something about trees that's difficult to get working in Java. (The entire terrain generation system now has more or less complete parity- with the notable exception of tree placement.)
This would be great for the Wild Update.

No support from me, sorry!

It is more difficult to release content for the Bedrock Edition since it must be compatible with many devices. 

To achieve this, they should develop it at least a month before, to then be subjected to certification (with the risk to be rejected and consequently to be not released in time for the first of April). This would be a huge waste of time that they could instead dedicate improving the latest beta version or developing a new one.

Old posts are removed from view at the start of each beta release so that feedback remains timely and specific to the current beta by request of the team. I'll add that to the pinned post. Hope that helps.
I see, thank you! Would it be appropriate to continue re-posting this until a response is posted, or is there a better place for this feedback?
Given the persistence (of the issue), I'm going to move it over to commands. :)
Hm thanks, though it is important to know that this is specifically feedback for the beta, and will become far more difficult to implement after the beta is released publicly.

That comes with Optifine, not the vanilla game.  If you really want this, search up "vanilla tweaks bedrock" on the net, go to the top website, scroll down and find borderless glass and borderless stained glass, select them, download the mcpd pack, restart minecraft bedrock, go into settings and then resource packs, put vanilla tweaks bedrock in, and you have java glass.  In other words, they should add this to the vanilla game.
That‚Äôs optifine

Please do this glass right now looks terrible. optifine makes it look so much better.

even if it was a option in resource packs.

Vanila Java doesn't do that, you need a mod for that called "Optifine" and it does more than just make connected glass, it increases frame rate (which is amazing for java, because java runs like if there was a literal bug in your computer) If only glass was connected in all versions ):

That's not what simulation distance is. Simulation distance doesn't have any effect on visibility, only on whether blocks and entities receive update ticks. The beacon beam disappearing is caused by a different rule that only renders entities within a certain distance of the player.
Thatcertian distance is sim distance

Not only beam Beacon power (effects) are also disappearing. If your beacon is out of simulation distance it's power disappearing even if you are in beacon radius. I have fully powered beacon so when I go to any border of beacon range effects are disappearing. if I increase simulation distance to 6 it's working fine
Please fix it if it's a bug
I'm playing on Minecraft for windows v1.20.12
I would more like those designs to return to Java than Java to send the 3D designs of the beds

I like the sprites. Difference is, on Java I can (and have) create a resourcepack that uses "CustomModelData:0" to replace the texture of the beds inside the inventory. Bedrock players can't do this if they don't like the change.
I saw a video on java once where this person was making a semi truck and used the bed's 3D model in an item frame as headlights.
Would be a nice change just for the sake of consistency across both versions. Besides, the 3d model is cool, why doesn't Bedrock just have it already?

You might not be saying add all Java offhand features to Bedrock, but I am! We deserve this easier way to mend tools/armor for sure, but we also deserve to be able to hold torches, use fireworks to fly, and hopefully place another type of building block from there too!

This would also abide by the current offhand rules, where an offhand item cannot have right click functionality. So, simply only allow for the Mending item in your offhand to be held and repaired but not used in any way.
Is that because you can sprint and eat at the same time in Java?

Yup, these actions like eating, blocking, using a bow, cross bow or trident all slow down the same amount on bedrock and java. On java you just don't stop sprinting when you start doing any action stat slows you down because of https://bugs.mojang.com/browse/MC-152728.
It would be nice if the block outlines on Bedrock could also become partially transparent and anti-aliased.
It‚Äôs seems crazy that this isn‚Äôt a thing yet even with new features they aren‚Äôt the same. Redstone could also use the hit box change java got a few years ago.

Yeah, it really bugs me.
https://bugs.mojang.com/browse/MCPE-74913

They are testing the impaling enchant in a combat test to do more damage if the entity is in the rain or water. This is a good addition because impaling only does more damage to fish, squids, and guardians. Don‚Äôt worry this will be in java soon.

I really like the trident and if this parity change as well as the "trident with loyalty enchant is not destroyed if it is thrown into the void, but instead still comes back" parity change make it through the combat tests, it may solidify the Trident as my go-to weapon (when I can get it, as those Java edition drop rates are still abysmal by default, IIRC). Still, yes please!

As it stands, an impaling trident is only useful in raiding an ocean monument. 

Outside of this scenario, a bow and sword combo are almost always favourable for combat.

It isn't even effective against drowned as they are considered 'undead' mobs and not 'aquatic'.
damn. couldn't have even made "drowneds" affected by "impaling". If they had just assigned it both categories the comment above this wouldn't've had to add it to the end of it.
Tridents do have an advantage underwater over other weapons- doing more damage at least against submerged entities (If merely touching water was considered too powerful) would be great.
